instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V5_S0: What is PP1V5_S0? PP1V5_S0 is a 1.5v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing PP1V05 S0
threads.message:
I have a water damaged macbook air that has been repaired to the extent that I'm just missing PP1V05 S0. I dont have an oscilloscope to see if PCH HSIO PWR EN is present. No water damage was near <CHIP>U8005</CHIP>. 

PP3V3 S0 = 3.324
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0</SIGNAL> = 1.508
PP1V05 S0 = 0.064
PP1V05 S0SW PCH HSIO = 0.062

Any help would be appreciated, thank you.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing PP1V05 S0
threads.message: 1V05 is generated by <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>, check voltages around there.
